Class BaseCalculatorModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • BaseCalculatorModel

  • public class BaseCalculatorModel
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class will do all the math for the calculator program. Once the calculations are done it will return the result to display.
    Author:
    Aleksandr Kovalev

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) int Base
      the base that the calculator is currently on
      private java.lang.String input
      the current input in the display, also used as if it is the display text.
      private int value
      int value of current calculation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BaseCalculatorModel()
      Default Constructor that sets up the calculator for use.

    • Field Detail

      • value

        private int value
        int value of current calculation.

      • input

        private java.lang.String input
        the current input in the display, also used as if it is the display text. the display always asks for this value.

      • Base

        int Base
        the base that the calculator is currently on

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseCalculatorModel

        BaseCalculatorModel()
        Default Constructor that sets up the calculator for use. The Base is also set to 10, by default.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Function that clears the input(Display) and resets the variables

      • currentValue

        int currentValue()

      • setValue

        void setValue(int x)

      • currentInput

        java.lang.String currentInput()

      • addInput

        void addInput(java.lang.String s)
        This function adds a String onto the input(Display)
        Parameters:
        s - the string to be added.

      • setNewInput

        void setNewInput(int x)
        This function sets a new value for input(Display). It takes in a number and converts it into a string in the current base of the calculator.
        Parameters:
        x - the number to be converted into a string

      • convBase

        void convBase(java.lang.String toConvert,
              int fromBase,
              int toBase)
        This function takes in a String, reads it, and converts the numbers into the current base, and then places them back into the string. This string will then be place into the input(Display) variable.
        Parameters:
        toConvert - the string to be converted into the new base.
        fromBase - the original base.
        toBase - the new base to be converted into.

      • Calculate

        void Calculate(java.lang.String expression)
        This function is the traffic cop that directs the program on which operation to use, based on the the current math expression sent to it. The function then calls one of the operations functions in this class, to find the value of the expression.
        Parameters:
        expression - A String that contains a math expression.

      • addition

        void addition(java.lang.String exp)
        This Function adds two numbers, from the expression sent. Then returns them to the input, which will be displayed as the answer on the calculator display.
        Parameters:
        exp - A String with a math expression.

      • subtraction

        void subtraction(java.lang.String exp)
        This Function subtracts two numbers, from the expression sent. Then returns them to the input, which will be displayed as the answer on the calculator display.
        Parameters:
        exp - A String with a math expression.

      • multiple

        void multiple(java.lang.String exp)
        This Function multiples two numbers, from the expression sent. Then returns them to the input, which will be displayed as the answer on the calculator display.
        Parameters:
        exp - A String with a math expression.

      • divide

        void divide(java.lang.String exp)
        This Function multiples two numbers, from the expression sent. Then returns them to the input, which will be displayed as the answer on the calculator display.
        Parameters:
        exp - A String with a math expression.
